benchmark_details.name: ModSCAN (Measuring Stereotypical Bias in Large Vision-Language Models)
benchmark_details.overview: ModSCAN is a measurement framework developed to scan and evaluate the stereotypical bias within Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) regarding gender and race across different scenarios, including occupations, descriptors, and persona traits. It identifies the presence of biases and suggests mitigation strategies.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To measure and understand stereotypical bias in LVLMs and provide insights into mitigating such biases.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Focus on only gender and racial stereotypes; future work will explore other aspects.

data.source: UTKFace dataset and images generated by Stable Diffusion (SD) version 2.1
data.annotation: The images are labeled based on gender, race, and age, facilitating analysis of stereotypical bias.

methodology.calculation: Bias Score is computed based on the frequency of stereotypical associations made by the LVLMs in their outputs for various attributes.
methodology.interpretation: Higher bias scores indicate stronger stereotypical associations, reflecting potential biases in model outputs.
methodology.baseline_results: LLaVA-v1.5 and CogVLM exhibited the highest bias scores, indicating significant stereotypical biases.
methodology.validation: The framework was validated through comparative evaluation across multiple LVLMs.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Focus on gender and race; future analyses planned for additional demographics.
targeted_risks.harm: Risk of perpetuating societal stereotypes and biases in decision-making processes.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Publicly available datasets used or generated data.
